title: fix(npm): use shim from deno_node crate for 'module' built-in module
body:
Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/15880

## Merge on approval

title: fix(npm): align Deno importing Node cjs with Node esm importing cjs
body:
Unfortunately, I don't believe there would be any way for us to make the `__esModule`/`default` checks work in a bullet proof way given that we need to analyze named exports ahead of time. Making it work would also probably lead to a lot of complexity that static analysis would fail us on in certain scenarios which would lead to probably requiring exceptions for certain packages. See discussion in #15876.

Closes #15865

title: perf(url): return early if url has no query string
body:
This small change returns early if the url being parsed has no query string. This gives a nice performance improvement when tested on Ubuntu 22.04 docker in unprivileged mode:

![Screenshot from 2022-09-10 23-50-54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/159073/189504669-0bc45351-eff2-4b63-bec8-6cb50785a79c.png)

I ran wpt tests as follows and all are passing.

```
deno run -A --unstable ./tools/wpt.ts setup
deno run -A --unstable ./tools/wpt.ts run -- url
deno run -A --unstable ./tools/wpt.ts run --
```

I can't bench right now on Mac or Windows so if anyone can verify they can see same thing there, that would be great.

this is my first Deno PR so let me know if i have missed something out.

title: fix(npm): support cjs resolution of package subpath with package.json
body:
Supports resolving directories that have a package.json and main entry pointing at something that's not index.js/cjs/etc.

Closes #15840

title: perf(ext/flash): remove string->buffer cache
body:
Removes an unecessary optimization: Apart from the possibility that the cache might explode due to uncertainties of timer callbacks, there is also a megamorphic property access hit which kinda cancels out its usefulness.

1.3x improvement on Linux. No change on OSX.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34997667/189491398-f0bd92df-c9c0-40ee-b51c-ccf3578ffc45.png)

title: fix(ops): Fix typo on readme
body:
# Description

This fixes the typo on `ops` README.

title: fix(npm): align Node esm code importing cjs with Node
body: This more aligns Node ESM importing CJS to have the same behaviour as Node, but keeps the current `__esModule` check that Deno does when importing CJS from npm. Essentially, this allows the Node ESM code to be comptabile with Node and the Deno code can be more comptable with what's done in the JS/TS ecosystem. That said, I suspect we may run into issues doing this though and may want to eventually align Deno's interop with Node's behaviour...

title: fix(npm): remove export binding to match node
body: Closes #15790

title: chore(cli): exclude npm registry data from crate package
body:
`cli/tests/testdata/npm/registry/` contains 22MB of data and that causes the error `max upload size is: 10485760` while publishing `deno` crate.

This PR excludes `cli/tests/testdata/npm/registry/` and avoids the upload error.

title: chore: bump url crate to 2.3.0
fix(core): opAsync leaks a promise on type error
body:
Two minor changes to `opAsync`:

1. Ops never return `maybeError` anymore. A type error is thrown directly, whereas synchronous errors from async ops are handled by rejecting the promise. Thus there's no need to check the return value.
2. If the async op throws, it would now leave the promise in the promise ring. We need to try-catch the error, remove the error and rethrow the error.

title: fix(core): make errors more resistant to tampering
body:
This commit makes error objects more resistant to prototype tampering.

This bug was found when updating the deno_std Node compatibility layer to Node 18. The Node test `parallel/test-assert-fail.js` was breaking std's assertion library.

Refs: https://github.com/denoland/deno_std/pull/2585

title: perf(runtime): short-circuit `queue_async_op` for Poll::Ready
body:
A nearly 5-20x improvement for async I/O operations that happen in a single tick. 

## Benchmarks

7x improvement in `opAsync("op_nop_async")` 
```
# this patch
target/release/deno run -A --unstable cli/bench/async_ops.js
time 43 ms rate 2325581
time 29 ms rate 3448275
time 27 ms rate 3703703
time 28 ms rate 3571428
time 28 ms rate 3571428
time 27 ms rate 3703703
time 29 ms rate 3448275
time 27 ms rate 3703703
time 28 ms rate 3571428
```
```
# main
deno run -A --unstable cli/bench/async_ops.js
time 200 ms rate 500000
time 180 ms rate 555555
time 181 ms rate 552486
time 180 ms rate 555555
time 179 ms rate 558659
time 179 ms rate 558659
time 180 ms rate 555555
time 179 ms rate 558659
time 181 ms rate 552486
time 179 ms rate 558659
```

4x improvement in TCP Conn.write (where all packets sent in one write call)

```
# this patch
Requests/sec: 751865.43
Transfer/sec:     36.57MB
```
```
# main
Requests/sec: 229258.34
Transfer/sec:     11.15MB
```

title: chore: fix flaky stdout_write_all test
body:
Adds back the `TaskQueue` from https://github.com/denoland/deno/pull/15092/commits/724fdd49e86ab69a792df63e5e47ec16aecebb8c#diff-c8dd7698dbd5b1b3e293ad2c98df1903aadbd893d3332fec60b229f8a180ea73

Tokio's sempahore doesn't seem to always give permits out in the order they were requested.

Note that the AsyncRefCell was removed in #15747 and a semaphore was used which caused this issue.

Closes #15771

- remove dependency on "node_resolver" crate
- make some of structures private to the "cli/node" module

title: fix(bench): make sure bytes/response is equal
refactor(npm): reorganize remapping built-in Node modules to remote URLs
body:
Changes how built-in Node modules are mapped to polyfills
from "deno_std". Instead of intertwining this logic into Node
resolution logic, we map them to "NodeResolution::BuiltIn"
which are remapped to "deno_std" URLs in ProcState.

title: feat(ext/ffi): Support bool FFI type
body:
Setup support for bool types in FFI. This enables both slow and fast API calls using booleans, since Fast API supports boolean to bool bindings.

Support for bools is also added for statics and `Deno.UnsafePointerView`.

Tests also done and tested, so this should be pretty good as-is.

### Dynasmrt Fast API
Adapting Dynasmrt PR to support booleans should be as easy as marking `NativeType::Bool` to take the same path as `NativeType::U8`.

title: fix(cli): allow using file resource synchronously while being used async
body:
This attempts to clone file resources when being used asynchronously in order to allow using a file resource synchronously while it's potentially being used asynchronously. If the file resource cannot be cloned, then the existing behaviour will occur where this is not allowed.

Closes #15708
Closes #13409
Closes #15268

 1.4x improvement in CSV parsing.

```
# Before

time deno run --allow-env --allow-read --allow-hrtime deno-csv-CSVReader.ts 500000-Records.csv
Read 500001 lines for 19.435 seconds

________________________________________________________
Executed in   19.50 secs    fish           external

```

title: feat(ops): support `v8::FastApiCallbackOptions`
fix(serde_v8): update bytes::Bytes layout assumptions
body: Fixes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/15566

title: feat(serde_v8): Support StringObject as unit enum variant
body:
Allow passing `v8::StringObject` as unit enum variant alongside `v8::String`.

`v8::StringObject` is currently treated as an object and fails due to `LengthMismatch`.

Not sure about using `to_string` instead of `try_from`.
`try_from` fails due to: `BadType { actual: "v8::data::Value", expected: "v8::data::String" }`

title: fix(npm): better node version and version requirement compatibility
body:
We initially used the `semver` crate as a first pass solution, but this PR adds way better node semver support.

Wrote an in-house solution so we can move fast fixing bugs and re-use some of the code for our npm specifiers. The npm specifiers use a stricter parser than the version requirements allowed in package.json files.

Closes #15600

title: chore(serde_v8): take mutable reference in `ToV8::to_v8`
body: Currently, its not possible to mutatate return value during serialization stage; which is required to support V8 external strings that take ownership of the bytes. Ideally, `to_v8` should take ownership but that doesn't seem possible. With this patch, you could use `Option::take` to take ownership (& leak) `ByteString`, etc inside `to_v8`.

title: feat(serde_v8): Serialize integers as BigInt
body:
Serialize integers as `v8::BigInt` when outside of the safe integer bounds for `v8::Number`.

Contrary to previous approaches this doesn't always return `v8::BigInt` therefore shouldn't be as serious of a breaking change.

Was getting malformed data when serializing arbitrary objects to Deno and deserializing back to Rust.

Closes: #12679

Inline `String` and `Option<String>` arguments in the #[op] macro bypassing serde_v8. 

Extracted from #15664

title: BREAKING(unstable): remove --compat mode
body:
This commit removes "compat" mode. We shipped support for "npm:" specifier support in v1.25 and that is preferred way to interact with Node code that we will iterate and improve upon. Compat mode adds a loooot of complexity and is ridden with strange bugs. 

I'm still not sure about removal of `--compat` - on one hand removal will break people's CIs, on the other I think it's better to break explicitly than accept this flag which will still break CI.

Effectively all issues below become irrelevant

- Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/15670
- Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/14662
- Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/14413
- Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/13883
- Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/13747
- Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/13424
- Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/13002
- Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/12482
- Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/13322
- Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/12495
- Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/13945

title: feat: add --no-npm flag to disable npm: imports
body:
This commit adds "--no-npm" flag, it's similar to "--no-remote"
flag. This flag makes Deno error out if "npm:" specifier is encountered.

title: fix(compile): panic when running with a populated dep analysis cache
body:
`deno compile` was panicking essentially every time. The fix was to have eszip parse the source if a `ParsedSource` didn't exist in the parsed source store.

The reason our tests did not catch this was because it would use a fresh cache each time. Updated the tests to check for this scenario, but the new design should not let this happen anymore.

Closes #15612

title: fix: config file errors should not print specifier with debug formatting
body:
Gets rid of:

```
error: Unable to parse config file JSON Url { scheme: "file", cannot_be_a_base: false, username: "", password: None, host: None, port: None, path: "/V:/dprint-plugin-typescript/deno.json", query: None, fragment: None } because of
```

and instead prints the specifier.

title: fix(ext/websocket): fix closing of WebSocketStream with unread messages
body:
This PR fixes issue https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/15616

The following logic is implemented:
1. When `close()` is called, we record when our close request was sent
2. If there are pending messages in the stream but the user isn't reading them (there isn't any active pull() running), we fast forward `pull()`
3. We do this until we either encounter a response close frame or if the server keeps sending other frames, a maximum of 5 seconds as per RFC 6455. The timeout is an extreme edge case in case the server is not written up to spec and does not reply with a close frame but rather ignores it and keeps sending other events.

The relevant [RFC 6455](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6455#section-5.5.1) statement:
```
the client SHOULD wait for the server to
close the connection but MAY close the connection at any time after
sending and receiving a Close message, e.g., if it has not received a
TCP Close from the server in a reasonable time period.
```

✅ all tests are passing, and the original PR issue at hand is fixed when testing with a build based on this PR

## Why are there both async and sync tests? 
Due to the various race conditions that exist - those four tests behaved differently with different edge cases.

## Why the `setTimeout(() => {}, 0)`?
Due to the nature of the bug, having to do with a race condition - we wanted the event loop to queue the logic after any `pull()` that would have naturally happened. Otherwise we would be failing on one of the sync edge case tests.

Most of the overhead is now in `normalize_path`.

title: fix(core): Register external references for imports to the SnapshotCreator
body:
Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/15619 
Closes https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/15620

Several functions used for handling of dynamic imports and "import.meta"
object were not registered as external references and caused V8 to crash
during snapshotting. These functions are now registered as external refs
and aborts are no longer happening.

----

After a lot of debugging, I found the causes of the Unknown external references, a reference to the promise created by `host_import_module_dynamically_callback` is kept by v8. when adding the catch function pointing to a local function it needs to be included in the ExternalReferences to be able to create the snapshot.

I moved the closures for the catch functions as functions, and register them in the external references, and  added 2 test cases to validate the issues

Before submitting a PR, please read http://deno.land/manual/contributing

title: serde_v8: fix pointer size assumptions
body:
serde_v8 cannot currently be built for 32 bit targets such as armv7-unknown-linux-musleabihf due to the code assuming pointers are 64 bits:

```
error[E0512]: cannot transmute between types of different sizes, or dependently-sized types
   --> serde_v8/magic/transl8.rs:108:3
    |
108 |   std::mem::transmute(ptr)
    |   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    |
    = note: source type: `u64` (64 bits)
    = note: target type: `&T` (32 bits)
```

This PR casts the serialized u64 fields to `usize` before transmuting and removes the hardcoded assumption that `size_of::<usize>() == 8`.

title: refactor(core): Move optional callbacks from `JsRuntimeState` to `ContextState`
body:
The `JsRuntimeState` struct stores a number of JS callbacks that are used either in the event loop or when interacting with V8. Some of these callback fields are vectors of callbacks, and therefore could plausibly store at least one callback per realm. However, some of those fields are `Option<v8::Global<v8::Function>>`, which would make the callbacks set by a realm override the one that might have been set by a different realm.

As it turns out, all of the current such optional callbacks (`js_promise_reject_cb`, `js_format_exception_cb` and `js_wasm_streaming_cb`) are only used from inside a realm, and therefore this change makes it so such callbacks can only be set from inside a realm, and will only affect that realm.

Towards denoland/deno_core#911.

<!--
